title: Shigeru Miyamoto and Shinya Takahashi Interview - Super Nintendo World Grand Opening!
description: Had the best time getting to visit Super Nintendo World at Universal Studios Hollywood! Thanks to Nintendo for the invite out!  PLEASE SUBSCRIBE:  GET MY PINK iJUSTINE CABLES HERE:   GET MY EDITING PLUGIN:    MUSIC I USE -   FRIEND ME HERE:        MY NEW PROJECT:   PODCAST:       WHAT I USE TO MAKE VIDEOS    CAMERAS: Sony a7 IV -  Sony a1 -   Sony a7s III -   Insta 360 ONE X3 -  Insta 360 ONE RS -  Insta 360 GO2 -   LENSES: New Sony GM 24-70mm ii -  Older Sony GM 24-70mm -  New Sony Sony 20-70mm -  Sony GM 16-35mm -  Sony GM 50mm -  Sony GM 135mm -  Sony GM 85mm -   AUDIO:  Sennheiser AVX Digital Wireless -  Sony XLR Adapter -  Sony Hot Shoe Shotgun -  Tiny Sony Microphone -  DJI Mics -  Rode Podcaster Pro II -  Podcaster Mic -  Elgato Wave 3 Mic -   DRONES: DJI Mavic 3 -  DJI Mini 3 -  DJI Air 2S -   LIGHTING: Aputure 600d Pro -  Aputure Light Dome II -  Aputure Amaran 200d -  Aputure 35in Light Dome -  Aputure Lantern Softbox -   Sony CF Express A 160g + Card Reader-  Sony CF Express A 800g -     These links are affiliate and by using them youre helping out my channel! Thank you!     BECOME A CHANNEL MEMBER:
transcript: - Oh my goodness, I cannot not be more excited. Right now, I am on the red carpet of Super Nintendo World. This is the grand opening of the theme park here in Los Angeles at Universal Studios. And in my hand, I have one of the power up bands. And what's exciting about this is this plays a crucial part inside of the park where you actually get to interact with things and participate in the games. And of course, to match my pink outfit we've got Princess Peach. (upbeat music) This is so exciting. Mr. Miyamoto, the last time I saw you was about 10 years ago and we played Mario Kart together, and now we are here in real life to witness it in person. (speaking Japanese) - [Translator] So obviously, the initial plan was to bring the world of Mario to life, but to actually see it realized now and for me to be surprised and kind of like, overwhelmed was something that I didn't expect. - Seeing these games being created for so long and now actually seeing them in real life, how are you feeling about that? (speaking Japanese) - [Translator] No, so I'm really looking forward to, you know when I saw this in actual real life, I was kind of surprised at how moved I was when I first saw it. And you know, I'm really excited and looking forward to how other people are going to react to that, and how they're going to feel when they see this place. - Mr. Miyamoto, now you've created such incredible characters throughout the years and now being able to bring them to life, what do you hope that people leave this park? What do you hope they leave feeling? (speaking Japanese) - [Translator] That's a good question. And you know, for a lot of fans, they probably have memories of video games, whether it's the characters or the backdrops and all of that. But then for them to come to this park and see that in real life, that I would just love to have that as an additional memory to the log of memories they may have from playing games. - Now I have been playing Nintendo ever since I was a little kid, so for me, this is, I'm getting very emotional just thinking about it. So for the newer generation of kids who are just coming in to playing Mario, Mr. Takahashi, how do you want like the next generation of gamers to kind of start interacting with Nintendo who may have never played before? (speaking Japanese) - [Translator] You know, there's going to be younger people who are going to experience the Nintendo for the first time at the park, and so I would love to see them experience some of the fun activities and games at the park, and then kind of reach out to Nintendo and see, oh there's also these kinds of activities, these kinds of experiences, and have interaction and expand out to Nintendo in that way. - Mr. Miyamoto, so you've obviously created so many incredible games. What advice do you give to up and coming developers to further their creativity? (speaking Japanese) - [Translator] You know, when we were talking, it's not really advice, but when we were talking with the creative team at Universal, we were really talking about the importance of really creating something unprecedented and something that's never been done before. And you know, when you're trying to compete with maybe an existing game, you have to kind of compete in that same field. But instead of doing that, I think there's a lot of joy and fun in trying to come up with something from scratch, from zero and I would love for people to be able to experience that joy as well. - This is such a huge year for Nintendo, obviously the theme park and the movie. So Mr. Takahashi, how do you feel bringing all of these characters to life? (speaking Japanese) - [Translator] And so, you know, there's a lot of different characters that I've spoken on. There's other many different games, but we really have a wide array of characters to interact with. So you know, as the manager of Mario, I would love to have people interact with many, many different ideas in our catalog. - So last question, which is a two-part question. What is your favorite food at the park and what is your favorite Super Mario character? (speaking Japanese) - [Translator] So I actually haven't had the chance to try out all of the dishes here at the theme park, but I can guarantee that the burger is a great choice here. - And do you have a favorite Mario character overall? (speaking Japanese) - [Translator] Through the movie and also the theme park, everyone will have a lot of opportunity to get to know with a lot of characters, but I personally wanna recommend getting to know Toad. He's very cute. - Toad is my favorite as well, other than Princess Peach, of course. (speaking Japanese) - [Translator] And I also haven't been able to try all of the dishes at the park, but the beverage, the lemon beverage that's there that I had yesterday was great. - That's amazing. Well, thank you guys so much. I look forward to checking out the park today. Thank you. (gentle music) (upbeat music) This is it. This is where I started crying when I watched this online. So it's like my childhood. Mario 64 literally changed my life. Like, I'm not even joking. It literally defined like my entire life and I'm standing in it right now. There's a tear, I have an actual tear. I'm unwell. My arm's gonna be so tired. Oh wow, look at Bowser. This is incredible. This is so magical. Like, you go inside and then you go outside and losing my mind. And now we're going into the castle. Even the soundtrack, the music, everything. I'm so happy right now. (upbeat music) There is so much detail. Everything is so thoughtful. Like the story of walking through this ride, it's expansive. If you're a Nintendo fan, this is somewhere you have to come. I feel like a princess. Bowser, I'm here. (upbeat music) Dude, this is so exciting. (upbeat music) So we're about to hop on the ride. We can't actually film while we're on it, but I do have some B-roll you can check out. We just got outta the Mario cart ride. This is what augmented reality is all about. Like, it was honestly shocking from start to finish. When I put the headset on and I looked down, and there were just coins floating. I mean it was like you were actually in the game. Like, there's no other way to explain it. Like, it felt like real life. So that was the grand opening of Super Nintendo World. I am just so happy. This honestly I would say is like, top three days of my entire life. I had the best time and I look forward to everyone else getting to experience this. I'm gonna go home, go to sleep, and get warm 'cause it's really cold out here. I know it's LA and California, but let me tell you what, it gets chilly here. (upbeat music)
